channel.title: Couture on RoxTheCasbah
channel.description: Recent content in Couture on RoxTheCasbah

item.title: EN - Ensemble Black Beauty
item.description: Je suis de retour pour te parler (roulement de tambours) … lingerie ! Surprenant hein ? × Ensemble Black Beauty #1 Je n’avais pas prévu de faire un ensemble au départ, mais il me restait de la dentelle, et j’aimais tellement le soutien-gorge que je me suis dit que ce serait vraiment dommage de ne pas en faire un ensemble. Le haut : Black Beauty Bra, d’Emerald Erin Bon, rien de nouveau sous le soleil, je suis repartie de mon soutien-gorge chéri, le Black Beauty Bra, dont je vous ai déjà parlé ici.

item.title: EN - Blue Beauty
item.description: Aujourd’hui on va parler lingerie. Jusqu’à il a quelques années, jamais je n’aurais imaginé coudre de la lingerie… Et pourtant ! × Blue Beauty #1 Je ne sais pas vous, mais personnellement, les boutiques de lingerie, ça a toujours été la plaie. Ayant la malchance de faire partie des grandes tailles, je ne trouvais jamais quoi que ce soit qui me plaise (sans me coûter un rein j’entends)(parce qu’un rein contre un soutif, j’aurais perdu au change)(et du coup je n’aurais pu avoir que 2 soutifs)(BREF).

item.title: EN - Un Diego en velours vert
item.description: République du chiffon est une marque dont j’aime énormément les patrons. J’aime beaucoup le style, un brin rétro. Même si j’aime leur esthétique, je sais que certains patrons ne correspondent pas forcément à ce que je porte au quotidien et à ce qui me va. Mais pour Diego, j’ai flashé au premier coup d’œil ! × Un Diego en velours vert #1 Diego le pantalon taille haute Diego est un patron de pantalon taille haute sorti il y a quelques années.

item.title: A green striped Pietra
item.description: As I told you on my Cielo article, I fell for Pietra, from Closet Core’s Rome collection, as soon as I laid eyes on it. I didn’t buyt it right away, I let it sit in my mind (and I had other things on my to-make list). But after a few months, I still liked it a lot, so I gave in, and bought the paper version at Metermeter (I don’t like assembling PDF for pants… So many pieces, so little time…)

item.title: A high-waisted pants study
item.description: A looooong time ago (in a galaxy far, far away), the only ting I was wearing was tight slims jeans. And low waisted jeans…shivers I don’t want to talk further more about these dark ages, now that I discovered high-waisted pants. And there is nothing else that I would like to wear. Where it began On paper, the high-waisted pants are a winner: it’s comfy, it’s got plenty of wiggle room, it shields you from the summer sun and keeps you cool.

item.title: A cropped top study
item.description: I’m back today to talk about this wardrobe staple: the white cropped top. How it began Noooo, don’t leave! Well, I know that cropped tops may remind some of you of the dark ages of the 90s. And I used to be one of those persons. I always thought it didn’t suit me, as I was too short, not thin enough (what beauty standards can make you think… sighs). But as a matter of fact, now as I started to wear more and more high-waisted pants and shorts and skirts, I began tucking my tees in.

item.title: Hello, world !
item.description: Hi there! Welcome on my brand new shining blog. This blog is going to be the place where I talk about sewing and knitting mostly. Maybe other DIY stuff if I feel inspired. My name is Roxanne, I’m a software engineer by day and crazy sewist and knitter by night. I decided to finally launch this blog, in order to document and share my project. OK, I know what you’re thinking about right now: ‘Blogs are so 2015, now with social media and Instagram, you don’t need one of those…'
